intro: Montanoa hemsleyana, commonly known as the Hemsley's montanoa, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in high-altitude regions. Its leaves are usually alternate and may have a hairy texture. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value.
